data.title: Sidelines: Gandolfo traded by Outlaws to Sussex
data.meta_description: The Chico Outlaws traded second baseman Bobby Gandolfo to the Sussex (N.J.) Skyhawks of the independent Can-Am League for right-handed pitcher Joe Gault and a player to be named later. Gandolfo, who lives in New Jersey, leaves Chico after playing second base in all but seven games in the Outlaws” two-year existence. The former Seattle […]
data.text:
The Chico Outlaws traded second baseman Bobby Gandolfo to the Sussex (N.J.) Skyhawks of the independent Can-Am League for right-handed pitcher Joe Gault and a player to be named later.

Gandolfo, who lives in New Jersey, leaves Chico after playing second base in all but seven games in the Outlaws” two-year existence. The former Seattle Mariners farmhand hit .287 for the Outlaws in 2006, driving in 25 runs and finishing third in the Golden Baseball League with a team-high 18 stolen bases. Gandolfo and Outlaws teammate Craig Kuzmic led the GBL with 60 runs scored last year, and Gandolfo”s 95 hits on the year were fifth in the league. Gandolfo had a club record 186 hits during his two years in Chico and his 28 stolen bases rank second all-time in team history.

Gault made 16 relief appearances for Sussex last season, posting a 2-3 record, one save and a 5.41 ERA. The 22-year-old Southern California native struck out 26 batters in just over 34 innings. A prep star at Canyon High, Gault was selected by Minnesota in the 22nd round of the 2003 amateur draft and spent three years in the Twins” farm system before joining the independent ranks last season.

CYSL soccer games begin Saturday

Chico Youth Soccer League”s spring season begins Saturday with games at Community Park.

Openings are still available in the following age divisions: boys and girls U7 (born 2001), boys and girls U8 (born 2000), boys and girls U9 (born 1999), boys U10 (born 1998) and girls U14 (born 1993-95).

CYSL will accept registration at the field Saturday from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. Fees are $35 per player plus a $25 buyout fee if you are not going to participate in the league fundraiser.

For more information, call the league at 894-1088.

NorCal Roller Girls seek skaters

NorCal Roller Girls is looking for skaters who are at least 21 years of age who want to join Chico”s Amateur Flat Track Roller Derby league.

Orientation meetings are Feb. 15-16 at Round Table Pizza on Mangrove Avenue between 8 and 10 p.m.

NorCal Roller Girls is beginning its second year as a roller derby league and has already begun competing, not only locally but nationwide. The club is chartered by USA Roller Sports, in accordance with its rules and regulations.

For more information, visit the club”s Web site at www.norcalrollergirls.com or e-mail kamiletoe@norcalrollergirls.com or call 343-1601.

DRPD sponsoring adult volleyball

The Durham Recreation and Park District holds adult volleyball on Mondays through March 26 from 7 to 9 p.m. at the Durham Intermediate School gym.

The cost is $3 to drop in and players must be at least 18 years old.

For more information, call 345-1921.
